dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, guess who's giving a shout-out to Walmart today? Elon Musk!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, guess who's giving a shout-out to Walmart today? Elon Musk!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, *Musk* and *praise* in the same sentence? Especially, like, for solar? That's, uh, new.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Musk and praise in the same sentence? Especially, like, for solar? That's, uh, new.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? Apparently, Tesla installed these new, state-of-the-art solar panels at seven Walmart stores globally. And they even emit a self-extinguishing glow!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Apparently, Tesla installed these new, state-of-the-art solar panels at seven Walmart stores globally. And they even emit a self-extinguishing glow!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Self-extinguishing? Okay, that's, um, a good start, given past issues.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Self-extinguishing? Okay, that's, um, a good start, given past issues.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Walmart's feedback was super positive. Tesla inspectors apparently noticed the "superior quality," featuring advanced cable connectors, all perfectly compatible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Walmart's feedback was super positive. Tesla inspectors apparently noticed the superior quality, featuring advanced cable connectors, all perfectly compatible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lawsuit alleges that Tesla inspectors didnt notice defects that were visible to the naked eye, used cable connectors that werent compatible with one another and failed to see that loose and hanging wires were present at multiple sites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, no loose or hanging wires?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, no loose or hanging wires?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] None! Zero detected! And you know what's even funnier? The market response to Musk's results call was described as "boring."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: None! Zero detected! And you know what's even funnier? The market response to Musk's results call was described as boring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Nothing Boring About Market Response To Musk's Mercurial Tesla Results Call

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: "Boring" for Elon usually means, like, a disaster. But here, it means... it actually *worked*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Boring for Elon usually means, like, a disaster. But here, it means... it actually worked?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! Walmart credited it to "meticulous, slow installations" and a business model that prioritized efficiency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! Walmart credited it to meticulous, slow installations and a business model that prioritized efficiency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, not the usual "move fast and break things" approach? They actually properly hired, trained, and supervised contractors?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, not the usual move fast and break things approach? They actually properly hired, trained, and supervised contractors?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's what they said! And Tesla, uh, immediately responded to Forbes, agreeing with all of Walmart's claims.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what they said! And Tesla, uh, immediately responded to Forbes, agreeing with all of Walmart's claims.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla did not immediately respond to a request for comment from Forbes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Remember when they acquired SolarCity back in 2016 for like, $2.6 billion? It was a bit of a bumpy road initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Remember when they acquired SolarCity back in twenty sixteen for like, two point six billion dollars? It was a bit of a bumpy road initially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got into the solar business after it acquired SolarCity in 2016 for $2.6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But since then, their residential solar panel production has just been skyrocketing, with really rapid sales gains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But since then, their residential solar panel production has just been skyrocketing, with really rapid sales gains.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But production of its residential solar panels under Tesla has been mired with delays and plunging sales.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is why Musk just announced a revamped pricing plan, right? To, like, maintain that momentum.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is why Musk just announced a revamped pricing plan, right? To, like, maintain that momentum.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just this week, CEO Elon Musk announced a revamped pricing plan in an effort to boost the slowing business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! Instead of just renting, residents can now purchase solar power systems outright. Starts at $50 a month in some states, or $65 in California.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! Instead of just renting, residents can now purchase solar power systems outright. Starts at fifty dollars a month in some states, or sixty five dollars in California.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new pricing model allows residents in six states to rent solar power systems starting at $50 a month ($65 a month in California) instead of buying them up front.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a more accessible, stable model. I guess even Elon can be, uh, boring in a good way sometimes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a more accessible, stable model. I guess even Elon can be, uh, boring in a good way sometimes.
